citation.article-title: Pseudonocardia mongoliensis sp. nov. and Pseudonocardia khuvsgulensis sp. nov., isolated from soil
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Pseudonocardia mongoliensis sp. nov.
Pseudonocardia mongoliensis (mon.go.li.en′sis. N.L. fem. adj. mongoliensis of or belonging to Mongolia, referring to the isolation of the type strain from soil of Mongolia).
Aerobic, Gram-stain-positive.
Cells grow well on Bennett’s, yeast-starch and ISP 2 agar at 28 °C, forming well-developed, extensively branched and non-fragmented substrate hyphae.
Extensive acropetal budding of the white aerial hyphae and the formation of blastospores are observed.
Very scanty aerial hyphae are formed, only on the surface of water agar.
The substrate mycelium is light to moderate yellowish brown to pale yellow on different agar media.
Optimal growth at 25–30 °C; no growth at 37 °C.
Grows at pH 4–11 and tolerates up to 2 % NaCl.
Catalase is not produced, nitrate is not reduced and gelatin, starch and Tweens 20 and 80 are not hydrolysed.
Urea is hydrolysed.
Arbutin is decomposed but casein, tyrosine, calcium malate, adenine and hypoxanthine are not.

According to the API ZYM enzyme assay, positive for esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), leucine arylamidase, α-glucosidase and β-glucosidase, weakly positive for lipase (C14), valine arylamidase, cystine arylamidase, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase and negative for alkaline phosphatase, trypsin, α-chymotrypsin, acid phosphatase, α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, α-fucosidase and α-mannosidase.

According to the API Coryne enzyme assay, positive for pyrazinamidase, alkaline phosphatase, α-glucosidase, β-glucosidase, urease and hydrolysis of gelatin, weakly positive for utilization of d-glucose, d-ribose, d-xylose, d-mannitol, maltose and sucrose and negative for nitrate reduction, pyrrolidonyl arylamidase, β-glucuronidase, β-galactosidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase and catalase and utilization of lactose and glycogen.
Peptidoglycan contains meso-diaminopimelic acid; diagnostic sugars are galactose, ribose, glucose, arabinose, mannose and rhamnose (trace).
Mycolic acids are absent.
The menaquinone system consists of MK-8(H4), MK-8(H2) and MK-8(H0).
Major fatty acid methyl esters are iso-C16 : 0, unknown ECL 16.05, iso-C16 : 1 H and iso-C16 : 0 2-OH.
The detailed fatty acid profile of the type strain is given in Table 3.
The G+C content of the DNA of the type strain is 73.0 mol%.
The type strain, MN08-A0270T ( = NBRC 105885T = VTCC D9-25T), was isolated from soil of Khuvsgul Lake, Khuvsgul province, Mongolia.
